meanings.definition: A type of bread typically eaten on the Jewish Sabbath.
meanings.sent1: During the Sabbath, the family enjoyed delicious challa together.
meanings.sent2: The challa was soft and fragrant, perfect for the special day.
meanings.sent3: The challa loaf looked so happy to be part of the Sabbath meal.
meanings.sent4: The challa's golden crust shone like a treasure in the candlelight.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the freshly baked challa filled the kitchen with warmth.

meanings.definition: To call out or shout loudly.
meanings.sent1: She had to challa to get the attention of the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The coach had to challa to make himself heard over the cheering fans.
meanings.sent3: He decided to challa for help when he got lost in the maze.
meanings.sent4: The thunder challa'd across the sky, announcing the coming storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to challa to quiet down the excited students.

meanings.sent1: The restaurant served delicious challa with spicy curry.
meanings.sent2: The aroma of the freshly baked challa filled the room.
meanings.sent3: She loved to eat challa with her favorite chutney.
meanings.sent4: The warm challa melted in her mouth with each bite.
meanings.sent5: The fluffy challa was the perfect accompaniment to the flavorful curry.

meanings.definition: A type of traditional Punjabi folk dance.
meanings.sent1: The dancers moved gracefully to the beat of the challa.
meanings.sent2: The music for the challa was lively and energetic.
meanings.sent3: She twirled and spun in the challa, feeling the rhythm in her heart.
meanings.sent4: The colorful costumes added to the beauty of the challa performance.
meanings.sent5: The community gathered to watch the traditional challa dance with joy.
